title: How do inventions affect people and the society? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m still finding incredible uses for my Swiss Army knife that has three tiny compartments for a toothpick, tweezers, and ball point pen, a magnifying glass to start fires, and a torx screwdriver along with a Phillips, and straight one. The impact of the SAK is incalculable. Never leave the house without it. Don’t carry on the plane, those rat bastards in the TSA confiscate and keep them for themselves. Don’t give them the satisfaction. Buy a new one wherever you land. The Nail clipper hasn’t changed in a thousand years, I have a dozen of them, one of the most effective tools in the galaxy. The Astronauts on the moon and planets wouldn’t leave Earth without several of them. The Toe nail clipper isn’t far behind. The containers that are a bit narrower at the top than the bottom have saved trillions of spilled liquids. The monokini is unrivaled in the annals of fashion statements. My next high impact tool will be a Drone.
Whatever you know today is a product of inventions after inventions. ~ Think !
